member_organisations:
The RWE network consists of the following bodies: 
 
The ‘Advisory Board on Regulatory Burden’ (ATR – The Netherlands) 
The ‘Finnish Council of Regulatory Impact Analysis’ (FCRIA – Finland) 
The ‘Nationaler Normenkontrollrat’ (NKR – Germany) 
The ‘Norwegian Better Regulation Council’ (NBRC/Regelrådet – Norway) 
The ‘Swedish Better Regulation Council’ (SBRC/Regelrådet – Sweden) 
The ‘Regulatory Impact Assessment Board’ (RIAB – The Czech Republic) 
The ‘Regulatory Policy Committee’ (RPC – The United Kingdom). 
 
Links for the above are at https://www.regwatcheurope.eu.
fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Sport, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication, Banking and financial services, Migration and asylum, European Neighbourhood Policy, Fraud prevention
eu_initiatives: Most of RWE's work is with regard to national legislation and regulation. We are interested in all EU initiatives and policies that are regulatory in nature. This is with a view to improving regulatory scrutiny and the quality of such regulation, not its policy content.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit: RegWatchEurope is a network of independent regulatory advisory bodies that play a significant role in scrutinising the impacts of new legislation in their domestic constituencies. We challenge and advise our national respective governments on various aspects of better regulation and on the overall regulatory burden of legislation to business.
